alert.note: Alert for Charleston; Coastal Colleton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 05 at 3:23AM EST until January 05 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM THIS MORNING TO NOON EST TODAY... * WHAT...Up to one foot of inundation above ground level expected along shorelines and tidal waterways (7.4 to 7.6 feet Mean Lower Low Water at Charleston). * WHERE...Coastal Colleton and Charleston Counties. * WHEN...From 8 AM this morning to noon EST today. * IMPACTS...This will result in some roads becoming impassable and minor flooding of properties. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tide will occur around 10:02 AM today at Charleston. Saltwater inundation will be possible 1 to 2 hours before and after high tide. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Charleston Harbor SC MLLW Categories - Minor 7.0 ft, Moderate 7.5 ft, Major 8.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.2 ft, Moderate 1.7 ft, Major 2.2 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 05/10 AM 7.5 1.7 1.1 N/A Moderate 05/10 PM 6.1 0.3 0.9 N/A None 06/11 AM 6.8 1.0 0.8 N/A None 06/11 PM 5.7 -0.1 0.6 N/A None 07/12 PM 6.0 0.2 0.4 N/A None 08/12 AM 5.6 -0.2 0.6 N/A None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
